summary:
I am ready for new challenges, back in Canada, now that I have graduated from Leiden University, Netherlands, in Law and Society: Governance and Global Devlopment (M.Sc.). Along with my 25 years of HR experience, this program has enabled me to reposition my point of view to an international context influenced by the advent of the latest issues facing society today.
As a trained legal professional, I’ve held various director positions in labour organizations representing members of the Canadian public service. As a member of the management team, I developed expert level skills in negotiating and lobbying, acting as labour union spokesperson while dealing  directly with high-ranking government officials. An accomplished communicator and mobilizer, I’ve headed cross-functional teams in the execution of various projects.

profile_positions.description:
PIPSC is the largest multi-professional labour union in Canada, representing 65,000 public service professionals employed at the federal and some provincial and territorial levels of government. Based on their profession and employer, the members belong to one of the 40 affiliated groups
At the Director, I had oversight over 3 divisions: Collective bargaining, Classification & Pay Equity, Pension and Benefits.
- 	Consolidated and solidified the 3 work teams (30 employees), under my purview, and ensured the sustainability of the service offered by implementing a skills development programme
-  Aligned the priorities and efforts of the 18 affiliated groups working for the Government of Canada and its agencies, so that the Institute had one unified voice on common issues
-   Positioned the Institute as the preferred interlocutor of the Government of Canada.  This led to substantial gains in terms of respect and promotion of scientific integrity, professional development, outsourcing, prevention of harassment in the workplace, parental rights, etc.
-  Negotiated with high-ranking public officials to enable agreements to be reached that met the specific needs of affiliated groups.
-  Co-chaired, in partnership with a representative from the Government of Canada, a multi-union committee to define a new short Term Disability Plan focused on early intervention and to facilitate a timely return to work.
-  Member of the Pay Equity Tri-Partite (Government, Employers, Unions) Working Group which provided advice to the Pay Equity Commissioner for an efficient implementation of the Canadian Pay Equity Legislation

profile_positions.description:
Trade union organization representing 60,000 healthcare and social service professionals 

Member of Managing Team (2008-2014)
- Defined the strategic direction that strengthened the Federation’s influence and implemented the related organizational and developmental direction of the Federation. 

Acting Director, Legal Team (2013-2014)
- Supervised and coordinated the workload of the prosecutors representing FIQ and its members on Labour and Occupational Health and Safety litigations
-  Set up discussion forums to promote cohesion among the 30 employees divided into two sub-groups (Legal and Occupational Health and Safety)

Director, Pension & Benefits (2008-2009, 2013-2014)
-  Lead the workload of 4 employees responsible for negotiating Pension agreements/plans with the government and Benefits with a private insurance provider, as well as supporting the members whose claims have been denied

Director, Human Resources (2009-2013) 
-  Developed the strategic role of the Human Resources department by integrating an Organizational Development function
- Advised the management team on all aspects of personnel management (performance, employee relations, team morale, professional development, etc.).
- Negotiated new collective agreements to facilitate the recruitment and retention of personnel as well as providing direction on their professional development.
-  Established a new salary structure with unions, one that reflected the evaluation of job duties. 
-  Established a new policy to prevent conflict and address harassment in the workplace
Director, Strategic Issues (2008-2009)
- Established the International Solidarity Program with workers of the Global South
- Updated the policy framework on prevention of harassment in the workplace.
profile_positions.title: Member of the management team  (2008 - 2014) and Director, Human Resources (2009-2013)
